Context:
Program Name: Information Systems Business Analysis
Code: T405
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $8,658.00 *
International Tuition: $18,174.00 **
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Computer Technology
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Experiential Learning: Mandatory Co-op or Work Integrated Project
Delivery:
- Semester 1 and 3: On Campus (Co-op in Semester 3)
- Semester 1, 2: Hybrid
Program Overview: The Information Systems Business Analysis program at George Brown College is designed to meet the need for professionals who can act as liaisons between business and information technology functions within an organization. George Brown is recognized by the International Institute of Business Analysis as an Academic Member.

* Domestic tuition is for Canadian students.
** International tuition is for students from other countries.

Context: The George Brown College offers a full-time Business Analysis program that prepares graduates to write the Entry Certificate in Business Analysisâ„¢ from the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA). This intensive program is designed for IT or business professionals, and those wishing to enhance their experience with formal education. The curriculum covers areas such as problem identification, documenting and analyzing user requirements, process and workflow modeling, communication and facilitation, project management, technical writing, leadership and management, and decision-making. The program is delivered in a blended format with face-to-face sessions and online delivery, accommodating those who wish to work while taking the program. Graduates of this program will be prepared to write the IIBA Entry Certification of Business Analysis designation. The college also has an Academic Membership with IIBA which offers benefits such as recognition for students of business analyst-related programs.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Information Systems Business Analysis Program (with experiential learning capstone) (Postgraduate) T405 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The Information Systems Business Analysis program at George Brown College introduces students to the latest technologies including Robotics Process Automation (RPA) and is now a member of the UI Path Academic Alliance. Students require a personal computer with a minimum of 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive, Quad-core i5/i7 2.4GHz processor, and a webcam for this program. In semester 3, students complete a Work Integrated Project or become eligible for co-op. The Information and Communications Technology Council recognized pervasive shortages for information systems analysts and consultant professionals through and beyond 2016. Common job titles in the industry include business analyst, business systems analyst, computer systems analyst, informatics consultant, information systems business analyst, information systems quality assurance analyst, and Management Information Systems (MIS) analyst. According to ICTC, there were approximately 150,000 business analysts and related professionals in Canada in 2011. BA roles have been the fastest-growing ICT employment occupation in Canada from 2000 to 2010, growing approximately 120%. Industry feedback includes testimonials from Advanced Chemistry Development, Inc. (ACD/Labs) and Porter Airlines about hiring successful business analyst graduates from George Brown College.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Information Systems Business Analysis Program (with experiential learning capstone) (Postgraduate) T405 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Information Systems Business Analysis program at George Brown College is a three-semester program. In Semester 1, students take courses such as BUS 4051 - Foundations of Business Analysis, BUS 4053 - Business Analysis Competencies and Techniques 1, BUS 4054 - IT Project Management, BUS 4055 - Quantitative Research/Qualitative Research, BUS 4061 - Business Analyst Case Study 1, BUS 4065 - Advanced Communications, and COMP 4017 - Introduction to Information Systems.

In Semester 2, students take courses such as BUS 4062 - Business Analyst Case Study 2, BUS 4063 - Business Analysis Competencies and Techniques 2, BUS 4064 - Business Analyst Software Tools, BUS 4064 - Career Planning and Portfolio Development, BUS 4078 - Trends and Perspectives in Business Analysis, BUS 4066 - Introduction to Analytics Systems, and BUS 4067 - User Interface Design/User Experience. Students also have the option to specialize in Finance or Cyber Security. In Finance Specialization, they take courses like FIN 1003 - Financial Systems in Canada and FIN 4015 - Canadian Securities I. In Cyber Security Specialization, they take courses like BUS 4110 - Introduction to Cyber Security and BUS 4111 - Cyber Security Analysis.

In Semester 3, students take courses such as TCOP 4002 - Co-op Work Placement or BUS 4081 - Work-Integrated Project. The program learning outcomes are not provided in the text.

Lynda Neil, PMP Manager at Porter Airlines Inc., and Amos Adler, President of MEMOTEXT Inc., have hired students from the Information Systems Business Analysis program and have had positive experiences with them.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Information Systems Business Analysis Program (with experiential learning capstone) (Postgraduate) T405 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Graduate has reliably demonstrated the ability to document business processes using established methods and improvement procedures.
- Manage requirements elicitation and analysis activities throughout the requirements process for changes to a business system.
- Analyze information collected during requirements elicitation to identify gaps and define capabilities of an acceptable solution.
- Document business requirements according to standard practices.
- Communicate results of business requirements analysis and documentation to diverse audiences using appropriate tools and styles.
- Develop test strategies to ensure business requirements and stakeholder objectives for changes to a business system are met.
- Apply negotiation and problem-solving skills to build effective stakeholder alignment.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $8,658.00 (for first two semesters starting Fall 2022)
- International Tuition: $18,174.00 (for first two semesters starting Fall 2023)
- Additional Costs: not provided in the text
- Semester 3 fees consist of a flat fee of $500 for co-op placement or work-integrated project (not included in the total tuition and fees above)

Admission Requirements:
- Two-year or three-year college diploma or bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Commerce, Engineering or related field from an accredited institution.
- Minimum one year of relevant work experience (resume required).
- Candidates will be accepted based on the combination of relevant education and work experience.
